subtitle: Minced lamb topped with cheesy mashed potatoes and root vegetables.

method.text: Dry fry the mince, onion and celery for 5 min, until the mince has browned and the vegetables have softened slightly.
Sprinkle over the flour. Stir in the tomato puree, stock, wine and seasoning. Bring to the boil. Simmer for 30 min, stirring occasionally.

Meanwhile, make the topping. Cook the potatoes, parsnips and carrots in boiling salted water for 10-15 min, until just soft. Drain well. Return to the pan. Mash with the milk, butter and cheese. Add the nutmeg. Season to taste.
Spoon the mince mixture into a warmed 1 <sup>3</sup>/<sub>8</sub> ltr dish. Shape the potato into egg-shapes, using 2 tablespoons. Arrange potato shapes on top of the mince.
Place under the grill. Cook for 5-8 min, to brown the top. Serve immediately, garnished with chopped parsley.
